basic.description:
An examination of the significance and diversity of drug cultures in the past century in the United States and Canada. The course focuses upon defining 'drugs' in changing historical contexts and locating their place within dominant socio/cultural groups and subcultures. The course also considers changing attitudes toward drugs over time, and official responses to drugs as a deviant force, including global, hemispheric, and national 'wars' on illegal substances. 
NOTE    Offered in alternate years starting in 2003-04.
basic.subject: HLTH
basic.title: Drug Wars and Cultures in 20th- Century North America
